text: We discovered this hotel in 2020 while walking on the beach. It seemed to us to be of quality. It's much better still. Flawless welcome, just don't arrive before 3 p.m. to get the room. Comfortable room with sea view It's perfect. Breakfast of very high quality, whether it's the service or the catering. In short, a perfect agreement

A lovely hotel with everything needed for a great family holiday. The staff are friendly and work extremely hard,they are a credit to this hotel in everyway. I Would of loved another week here. My boys loved it especially the soccer games. They loved the freedom of getting their own drinks,icecream etc.Pools were great, cold but once in it was grand and im sure in the weeks ahead when the real hot weather hits the temperature will be perfect. I thought the food was great especially for my younger son who's so fussy, his diet was way better out here than back home, ate loads of fish, rice ,fruit etc, to be honest I couldn't get over all the food so much of it and always something available to eat every hour of the day. Loved the coffee machine thought the cappuccinos tasted so good and boys loved getting the hot chocolate out of them. Would definitely come back here again, maybe next year.

Just back from a week staying in this hotel. Family of 4, children aged 12&10. We had a great time, hotel was clean, great selection of food, albeit it was a bit cold, but salads, dessert and fruits where great.Snack bar by pool was great, found the food to be fresh despite other reviews. Swim up bar was great for the kids to get drinks, especially the strawberry slushieüëçüèª. Kids entertainment was good during the day, kids enjoyed playing footie in the astro beside the pool. teens room with pool table etc was great to entertain older kids in the evening. Pity Friday is packed with entertainment at pool, would be good if it could be spread out over the week, due to our arrival and departure time we missed the foam party, which only happens on a Friday afternoon.Alcreim al a carte restaurant was great, kids both got steaks at no additional charge. Other al a carte restaurant was not to our liking, but if you are a real meat lover it‚Äôs for you.Great shuttle service to old town, but download the Uber app as bus can get full and Uber will arrive in a couple of mins and is cheap.Room was noisy at night from the bar across the road, who played music in speakers outside.Overall a very enjoyable stay

Travelled solo with 12 year old and 10 year oldExcellent food really fresh, lots of choice for picky eatersstaff excellent service and lots to do for kids.Hotel resort felt really safe confident in letting kids go to the different areas within the complex themselves

Not a hotel we Can recommend, and will never return!Too much noise, kids running around everywhere, screaming throwing toys in every room of the hotel!Silent pool is not even a place to relax, and no staff is doing anything about the rule breaking from the kids and people yelling and hearing loud music.If you want to relax, just stay home.

We were thoroughly pleased with our stay here. On the advice of a TA report, when we checked in, I asked for a room on a higher floor. As they were not booked out, we got one on the fifth floor and facing east, which afforded a perfect view of the beautiful cliff and tiny beach.Don‚Äôt even think about saving money by reserving a less expensive room; this place is all about the location ‚Äì splurge on a sea view room. Even just waking up to the ocean view is worth the higher rate.I can‚Äôt understand the negative ratings from the summer; all was working well in September, having gotten set up with the Covid-19 regulations. All of the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. The few minor problems we had in the room were taken care of very quickly using the request form on the hotel app. Special mention to Riccardo who was always upbeat; he helped us with our luggage and gave us some travel tips to boot.The hotel address was not on our rental car GPS, and it‚Äôs a bit tricky to find if you‚Äôre unfamiliar with the area. Coming from the highway, head down to Carvoeiro Beach, and at the end of the street by the beach, make the u-turn back up, then take the first right. The hotel is about a kilometer uphill from the beach. There is plenty of free parking on the premises.We had half board with meals in the buffet restaurant. The food was of good quality, although it was strenuous and took usually a while as you had to stand in a queue for your food (wearing a mask) because the staff served the portions. Coffee and tea is available in the room and replaced daily; there are minibar items to purchase. Our superior room was nicely decorated in white and grey, with good lighting. The fitness room has several endurance machines, a Smith machine, and a selection of dumbbells. There is a small indoor heated pool; the mail pool outside is not heated. The Sky Bar is not to be missed. Evidently the hotel is very popular with British guests.There are a lot of restaurants along the street down to the beach so if you don‚Äôt get half board, and are willing to walk a bit, you will find plenty of places to eat at.Report within report of The One restaurant at the hotel:Since we had half board and found out that we could get credit towards a meal at their The One restaurant, we were glad to have a chance for a proper sit-down meal after several days of standing in line and wearing a face mask at the buffet. They deducted ‚Ç¨25 per person from the tab (well actually they forgot, but corrected this at checkout when I pointed it out). The service that night was relatively slow even though not all the tables were taken when we arrived.All of our dishes were presented quite beautifully. However most of them somehow lacked pizazz, meaning the flavors were more on the ordinary side, and the portions were not particularly large. In general we were not overly impressed, and in combination with the higher prices, would not necessarily recommend it as the ultimate dining experience.

We stayed at the Tivoli from September 4th for 2 weeks and once again we absolutely LOVED it - From the time we walked into the Reception and were met by Katerina, Marie, Juliet, Rui and Marcus and Helen it was like coming home !! They  were all so very helpful and helped me with the mountain of paperwork needed for passage both in and out of Portugal.The Breakfast buffet was lovely and we always had a lovely table overlooking the sea thanks to Maria, Danielle and Carina. We ate out at night but there was a really good choice of tavernas and restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel and if we wanted to go into Carvoeira a taxi was with us within minutes.Everything about this hotel was perfect for us, the pool was lovely, no problem getting sunloungers and our coffees and beers served on our loungers made it ideal !!!The Staff cannot do enough for you and all I can say is roll on July 2022 when we will be there again.Wendy and Brian Robinson

Me & my Husband had our Honeymoon in Funchal and we stayed at Hotel Madeira, upon arrival at approx 9pm on a Friday night we were greeted by 2 very friendly guys on reception, they were very welcoming and explained everything to us and checking us in quickly.  The hotel is located very central so you have easy access to all parts of Funchal.  We found our room to be a bit on the small side but for us 2 it was fine (we would of liked a bigger balcony - only downside), the room was very clean and it was cleaned everyday, unless we advised the maids otherwise.  Breakfast was very nice, continental but they also had a small variety of hot food.  The roof terrace pool was very clean.  Service was also spot on.  There is some building work going on nearby so you could hear the noise, but to be fair that didnt bother me.  All in all the hotel was very well kept.  I do have to say a special shout out to the 2 young men who did check us in on arrival, they did answer all of our questions, we wanted to get a taxi for a local fishing village and they advised us the best way to do this and also the cheapest, they are an asset to the hotel.  We will definitely return to Funchal and we will also stay at Hotel Madeira.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Had a nice stay. Rooms need upgrade as a little dated.We were in a twin and although a sizable room the beds were glued together and hard to separate. Breakfast was fine.Good location near beach and bars etc. would stay again if in area.

What a lovely hotel.Stay was for 5 days in May 2022, myself and daughter.We were given a beautiful apartment on the ground floor over looking the pool and sunset.The majority of the rooms are actually apartments which are huge! Seriously the bedroom is 30m¬≤ and the lounge must be 35m¬≤.The interior of the hotel has a slight Moroccan feel to it. Very luxurious.The breakfast was a higher quality than standard.Great location, 10 mins to the Strip and 15mins walk to the main town. Bus stop right outside the back entrance and a play park for the kids opposite.Can't fault this hotel, will defo come back here in the future.

We stayed four nights in mid September 2025 and really enjoyed this flat. It‚Äôs in a great location and the hosts were wonderful. We had the breakfast option that included fruits, coffee, tea, baked goods and a nice welcome bottle of wine. Everything was very clean and the hosts helped coordinate our connections. We had an excellent time and would definitely return.

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: We stayed here in the middle of July for 3 nights as a family.  The suite was lovely with two bedrooms and two bathrooms, lounge, kitchen and a large bedroom with very comfortable beds. It is a very large resort and difficult to find your way around, the cliffs are very dramatic down to the beach which is beautiful.  However the beds are packed together like sardines in a very small space making it feel claustrophobic.There is a huge choice of restaurants but you have to be very organised and book days in advance as everywhere was booked when we got there. The gym was excellent and the staff first class and knowledgeable.  My biggest issue was paying for wifi, we paid nearly 1000 euros a night and then an extra 10 a day for wifi which seems miserly.  We were also charged 1.50 euro for a banana for my young son which seems petty (everyone else took them from breakfast).  Whilst I did enjoy Pine Cliffs I will not return as I found it over priced and over busy.

Just returned from a week AI at Forte Do Vale and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The staff were excellent and very attentive at all times, from the reception to the bar staff, dining area and the cleaners. The accommodation, 1 bedroom deluxe apartment, was excellent with loads of room for the 4 of us and, although we never used what was available, it even had a kitchen complete with dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer, etc.I'll be honest, the food was maybe a little light on selection but there was always something to pick from, either soup, main courses, salad or sweet.The pool area was also excellent although I'll qualify that by saying it wasn't too busy and we had no problem getting sunbeds, etc.Reading other reviews regarding loud music, etc I can honestly say we had no problem from that point of view. A little quiet music was played when the pool bar was open.... nothing out of order at all.Thanks for a great stay

special placespecial peoplethank you for my amazing New Year stayso cozy and charmingfeeling at home best location and neighborhoodroom is exactly as picturedfull of light, very large and comfortablethe bed exceptionally comfortable - very nice to sleep inthe house which was nicely decorated in retro style, is kept very clean every dayhearts and hugs go to Joao and Sara

Restaurant with good quality food and Italian flavors, a good variety of starters, a calm atmosphere and very attentive staff. I really enjoyed the experience and would like to repeat it on a new stay.

The apartment is superb and if you are visiting Porto, strongly suggest for you to stay here. The quality of the furniture is simply amazing, I would actually compare it to a hotel suite in a 5 star hotel. The location could not be more central, you walk 5m to the right of the apartment and you are by the river and the Luis bridge where you can cross and visit the caves of Porto wine. You walk 5m to the left and you are in Rua Flores where the night life and the restaurants are always buzzing. Lastly, the hosts were very professional and knowledgeable and very proud \Porto\" people so they went above and beyond with suggestions from best restaurants to go to
month: all the way to the key shopping areas and best tourist routes. I would not hesitate in staying at these apartments whenever I visit Porto again!"

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Traveled from NYC to meet my best friend from Finland for a quick trip to Lisbon. VALVERDE out did itself! Room and breakfast were amazing! The staff impeccable! Started with Ivan who carefully and in detail explained where I might be interested in going after listening to my interests. He set up an amazing private tour with Gustavo to the town of Sintra and the coastline nearby. Gustavo was a fantastic guide who patiently and expertly drove us in his Audi A6 to areas which interested us. Had an amazing seaside lunch arranged by him along the way!  Can‚Äôt wait to visit again!

I stayed in Marriott Lisbon with my family from 20th till 24th May.It was a truely wonderful experience, right from  the time we got off the cab.All the staff  from the bell boy, the reception, restaurant, concierge, housekeeping were extremely warm and helpful.We had a nice spacious room with a balcony facing the city.Breakfast was very nice.The hotel is nice and spacious and very welcoming.I will definately recommend it to friends and family who are planning to visit Lisbon.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: It is our fifth Belmond resort to visit after Splendido, Cipriani, Sant'andrea and the Orient Express.We had high expectations as the resort is well known as well as the highland Madeira.We had organized a transfer through the package Discover Madeira and arrived smoothly to the hotel. Unfortunately we could not have early check in (in our package but upon availability) so we went to the pool for a lunch.We had a beautiful room 960 with a splendid panoramic view on the sea. We recommend old building which has more charm.What makes this resort amazing is the access to the ocean with beautiful setting and beach service (you can also rent free of charge kayak). All the staff at the beach were professional (all young people well managed by more senior manager) and helpful to find some space as the place is tiny on the rocks.We had massage at the Spa which was of high quality.Breakfast had high level of service, though as the hotel was full some dishes were not replaced for example there were short of cherries and strawberries at the breakfast during the week we stayed.We tried all the restaurants and enjoyed it: Brisa do mar has beautiful view as well as the bar and food was delicious. William starred Michelin was also a nice experience. And Cipriani did not fell short of delivering quality food with again beautiful view. We celebrated during the dinner my friend's birthday and the chef prepared a nice lemon cake for the occasion. All the evening went perfectly well and we could speak italian with one of the waiter who was from Italy.The concierge helped us to organize a trip for hiking in the mountains which was worth it as well as booking restaurants outside the hotel.The staff was professional and helpful during all the stay. We also appreciated to be invited to the GM evening cocktail and my friend had nice bottle of prosecco for his birthday delivered to the room.We missed though some entertainment in the evening as in other Belmonds we used to have a pianist playing after dinner.We could benefit from late check out, we had the room till 3 pm which is quite exceptional.Overall we recommend this hotel for the setting, the level of service and the quality of the food served in the restaurants, it is also very affordable compared to other Belmonds in Europe.

My friends and I stayed one week in the Lagos surf hostel and came back home with a lot of great memories.The hostel is very big, has a pool and a comfy living room. The hostel provides breakfast and a small lunch (sandwiches) and if you want you can cook your own meals. Every three days there's an event where you have a bbq for example or go out and eat together with other guests of the hostel. Also, there is a \play room\" where you can play ping pong and listen to music. The pool was a great way to relax after surfing.The beds are clean and comfy. We even had our own bathroom inside our room. The people working in the hostel are extremely friendly and outgoing. Furthermore
month: the hostel is only a three minute walk to a supermarket (Aldi) and 15min from the old town.I would strongly recommend this hostel to anyone who is looking for a comfy
year: fun and chill stay in lagos.I will definitely revisit the hostel!"

text: Very nice hotel with a terraced cottages & garden layout. Cottages have usual layout of bathroom with walk-in shower and  bedroom with 2 large beds, desk and chairs and outside patio area with table and chairs. Cottage floors are traditional hard ceramic tiles and room has efficient air conn unit and rooms were servced daily. Outside, the cottages have rambling flowers and cobbled-stoned walkways with well managed lawns and gardens full of flowers. A number of historical buildings remain onsite and are open and very interesting. Pool is clean and a good size (1.25m deep) with plenty of space for loungers there is also a shaded cafe/bar serving drinks and lunches. Main restaurant is very pleaeant with plenty of choice and variety, while the main bar is a nice relaxed room with excellent, experienced bar staff. All staff were very happy and helpful, cleanliness of all areas was excellent. The hotel is in an isolated coastal location away from all other facilities with secluded coastal beach walks and amazing variety of birds and salt lagoons. We were aware of this before visiting and a taxi to/from Tavira was only ‚Ç¨8, while many guests had bicycles to tour the local villages but a car may be suitable if you intend to visit the town frequently or travel the wider area . One warning - due to the lovely wetlands around this coastal area, at night-time there are mosquitos outside in large numbers and we were bitten many times before buying anti-mosquito spray to repel them and treatment for bites, so suggest you come prepared .. or restrict your time outside after dark

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Walked up from the port on a rainy day and decided to call in for lunch. All the staff were so friendly and the food and local wines excellent. We‚Äôll have to go back for a few days and explore the lovely Island of Madeira.The total cost of a one course lunch with wine and coffee came to approx ¬£85. Bread and petit fours were complimentary. Excellent value

We had a wonderful time staying in Lisbon, the on premises bar and restaurant made it easy as it was raining on both days. There are a few good restaurants nearby and pretty close to metro if you wanted to use it. Make reservations for the Spa ahead of time we could not get a slot.

Reasonably priced with excellent service and a nice location for tourists. We arrived early, so they kept our bags for us. When we returned, the room was ready and our bags were in our room. They have an excellent breakfast as well as a nice rooftop bar.

I've been to Algarve Surf Hostel twice now, and I'm going back this summer. Do I really need to say more? This hostel is the best. Staff is nice, rooms are nice and clean, everything about this hostel is awesome. They make you breakfast in the morning, and even pastry sometimes, they have a pool and a grill. Seriously what else do you need? If you're looking to surf, make new friends, and have the time of your life, go there. And even if you're not interested in surfing, you can still go there. It is everything you've ever expected and even more. Lagos is a lovely city, and this hostel is well located. You can walk to everywhere between 15-20 mins (restaurants, bars, the closest beach, grocery store, etc.), but if you're not walker (or you're a little drunk and it's 5 AM in the morning), cabs are very cheap. I recommend this hostel to everyone. Great time and great memories. Thank you Algarve Surf Hostel !

Lisbon Marriott HotelLisbon Marriott HotelMarriott Hotels$99Marriott Bonvoy member rate available with free signupEligible for shopping rewards from loyalty sitesView DealView all 14 deals from $94Lynda LNaples, FloridaClose to airport, far from attractionsReview of Lisbon Marriott HotelPending reviewThis on the whole is a lovely hotel. I will say upon arrival there was no teeth and eyes from the front desk clerk. I gave him my name and he looked at the computer and asked why I had 4 reservations (which was incorrect). No welcome or anything (and I am a lifetime Titanium member). The next stop was the concierge to ask a question. He was wearing a gold key so I expected decent attitude. I asked my question and he was so dismissive I avoided him the rest of the stay. The room was lovely although chairs on the balcony would have been nice. My room overlooked a hospital and the airport. We never got the room cool either. We had lounge access. This lounge should be used as a standard for other lounges. The food was always replenished. The staff (Phillippa and the other evening girl) especially were fantastic. Every evening was a different selection of hot and cold food. So nice after the Milan Marriott where every evening was the same awful food. This lounge is large with outdoor seating overlooking the pool. Truly a highlight. What I thought was great was when a woman came into the lounge with 5 guests. The girls told her very nicely that she was allowed 1 guest. I like that they stuck to the rules. They were there for a convention and probably she took an lounge access room and figured she would bring them all in for the free food and drink.  It was good to see them adhering to the rules.So would I stay again?  I am not so sure.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: We stayed here by chance after moving from a hotel that was flooded. From the moment we checked in, the friendliness and helpfulness of all staff was evident. The hotel has only been open for 3 weeks but as it it is in an old building, it has a wonderful old world feel of a family run hotel. The staff are all decked out in smart Lacoste outfits. We ate in the restaurant twice and the food was excellent. The breakfast was just as good. Our room was comfortable and clean with a wonderful bathroom and great views through the windows. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again on my next visit to lisbon.

Location settings were very peaceful with the estuary river running 50 m  parallel to the rear of the hotel.Once tide was out the beach was exposed. Nice place to walk along. Rest a while or fishing. The  locals use the area for a day out. Most times the Hotel car park was full, I would guess this is part of the reason. I came from Faroe Airport and took a taxi travelling solo. The Taxi fare I thought expensive, 54 euros. You would be far better pre booking on line for a better deal,That was one way.I did not want the hassle. I paid the price.The hotel is located in a Bird Sanctuary most of which looks like Marsh land.You can buy a 3 euro ticket at the reception for a ferry which will take you around the peninsula to sandy beaches.Choice of two ferrys.There is a shuttle bus running from the hotel and will drop off and pick up at the Hotel .It will take you into Tavira and bring you back at scheduled times. If you have the same driver as I had he will look and act as if you do not exist and could not care anyway !Not the caring type perhaps.I used this transport a few times. If you wish to come back before the bus pick pick up, the taxi fares from Tavira were very good. About 5euro. I did not rate the breakfasts or the dinners, It was never hot enough.The choice was varied as you would expect. A lot of seafood, It looked good. In effect it all tasted similar.I was fully inclusive but I eat out most days.The snack bar was very  good. Anything from toasted sandwich to coffee or alcohol soft drinks and ice cream. To eat at a table or take to the pool area which is close by. The problem of finding a sun lounger was easy. Never a problem. Plenty for all. That is a first for me.The staff were multi tasking and in some cases it showed. The entertainment crew around the pool area seemed very amateurish. But relied on the atmosphere  to get  through there act.The room I had was pretty basic and although it had two chairs and a table just outside the rear door. No privacy, as you looked directly through a very thin hedge in front and a strip of soil with some weedy looking plant  from next door On the other side I had a air conditioning unit plodding merrily away.The cleaners were friendly and helpful . I maintained myself basically. The hygiene was standard. I love my coffee and found that you can borrow one from reception on request with no charge. Made my day !. I would not return to this hotel again. I have given it a 3 rating but it should have 3.5 to be fair.I have tried to be fair throughout .We are all different and have varying tastes. You might love it!!

Nice place to stay at very reasonable prices, excellent for off peak breaks, local village has some nice cafes and restaurants, shops are basic but that was all we required.Coastal path from the hotel to the village can be challenging for the older traveler, however there is a nice board walk part of the way.

The hotel is still being refurbished and there is construction activity daily. It reopened too soon. The sauna, steam room and indoor pool were closed and the spa was offering a reduced service. There were no fire or emergency exit instructions in the room. Fie hoses were being installed and some fire doors are missing. Aircon didn't work in our room and the room phone didn't work. Food in the restaurant wasn't hot enough and quality was mediocre. We complained about the room and we were eventually moved to a better room with aircon that worked and a phone that had a dialing tone but no directory, so we still couldn't use it. There's no entertainment provided. There are umbrellas around the pool but nowhere else in the grounds, so you're limited to where you can sit, unless you're a hardened sun-worshiper. The staff are very friendly and helpful, but they lack  leadership and management direction. This hotel does not justify a five star rating, it's a three at best.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Great Hotel, best i have stayed in, fantastic staff. Great food,in all outlets . William  Restaurant  is fantasticGood facities. Hotel with a historyOrganised trips were perfect, with guides and driver

Stayed here for five nights with no complaints at all. The apartment was extremely clean and cleaned daily. Carlos met me and gave me some tips about the city which were helpful. Air con was great and the kitchen was very useful. Enjoyed having a coffee maker and a lovely bottle of wine. It was very quiet and I felt very safe staying there.The location is fantastic as I was able to walk everywhere. A great restaurant called Fabulas is just a few minutes walk away and I ate there for three of the nights I stayed although there are many food options available.If I ever return to Lisbon I would definitely stay here again.

This was one of my favourite hostels I've stayed in during my travels. The location is very convenient, just a few minutes to walk to the beach, or approximately 10 minute walk from the train station. The staff were really friendly, and I had a great time going out with the other guests for their pub crawls. I was also around for a booze cruise or two! I stayed in a four person dorm, which had its own private bathroom. This hostel also has a rooftop patio which is a great place to chill out. Plan to return to Lagos, and likely to this hostel!

Great place to stay in Funchal. In walking distance to the town. Staff very friendly, clean and tidy surroundings, great pool areas, good rooms and very spacious. Drinks and food served everyday and entertainment most evenings.

Cockroaches in the bathroom that need to be treated urgentlyA view from the balcony of an empty swimming poolFriendly staffWell located to start the Camino de SantiagoGood basic breakfastFresh orange juice to offerGood bedding

The location of this hotel is outstanding,on the rugged Algarve coastline. The hotel is newly refurbished to a high standard, rooms are clean and comfortable with great views. The staff made it though, they were so friendly, professional and hard working

Visited the Royal Savoy twice now in the last 6 months. Our first visit last August was excellent. We wanted somewhere warm for a quick February half term break so decided Madeira again as it's so close and easy to travel to from the UK. Wherever you go in Madeira, people are so friendly and polite. We were lucky enough to have a 5th floor balcony for first visit, for beautiful views of the sea and then a ground floor room this time round, although we didn't have the views, it was really convenient with my 8 year old, to access the pool area without getting dressed to walk through hotel. Food is excellent, amazing breakfast every morning, eggs cooked to order and the fruit tastes so much nicer in Maderia. Choose this hotel for a relaxing stay with good food, friendly company, quiet, clean and well maintained pool areas. It really is paradise.  Will be going back again soon!

What a view! The pool, the vinyard, the mountains, the nature...and most of the time the sun. Excellent stay in a very nice, big room. Very large breakfast buffet and friendly staff around. We had a great time.

Arrived in Lisbon with my husband and stayed at the Gatrooms before setting off to see the rest of Portugal.  We were so happy with the place we returned and stayed again just before we left for home.Great value for money, central, quaint and trendy.

I would definitely recommend staying, the staff very helpful, excellent location, much attention to details, at night might be loud because of garbage pickup at 3am but only if the windows are open. For dining do not go to tourist traps but rather to Bairro Alto or Alfama where there are excellent family digs.

Just returned from a lovely week here, it is a lovely complex to stay for what they say is a studio we had an entrance hall a large room with twin beds a sofa and dining table and chairs, a large balcony overlooking the street above the reception area a separate well equipped kitchen and a bathroom . The staff were all very friendly we would certainly return in the future. Very good location for all amenities in the area.

Lovely hotel, really friendly staff, rooms cleaned every day, great size swimming pool, plus kids pool. Great selection at breakfast. Next to the beach and less than 10 minutes to Marina. Would stay there again for sure.

I Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Pestana Viking. The location was ideal and so was the service at the hotel and not to mention, I managed to catch a bit of sunshine and plenty of vitamin D. Considering the weather in the UK and most of europe, I was actually surprised to catch some sunshine.

It was my second stay in this wonderful Palacete, which a few years since my last visit I continue to highly recommend, and will definitely come back.From the way I was received by the owners with the greatest sympathy and kindness, to the small mimos (I do not want to spoil the surprise to any future guests) that they provide the whole experience is amazing.The space is absolutely spectacular, inside the Palacete where we feel transported in time to a noble past, as in the suites of welcoming and intimate design that give to a pleasant and well-maintained garden with a wonderful lawn. The pool is very nice and clean - even in November was good enough time to be able to enjoy.It was a very pleasant weekend, where I used to rest and recover sleep in a bed that looked like a cloud, and despite sleeping late the owners were always very happy with breakfast.The visit to the Chocolate Factory is something unique, that even after so long I again gave for myself immersed as if it was the first visit.Anxious to return to this second \home\""

Me and 2 friends stayed here the end of March for 1 week in a sea view self catering apartment. The apartment was amazingly equipped for self catering, our only complaint is that the oven had a microwave feature which was pretty useless, but we worked around that.Room was cleaned daily and bins emptied. The shower was absolutely amazing and was something we all commented on. I can't really fault the self catering at all and we had such an amazing view from our balcony over the pool and the beach.2 minutes walk to the beautiful beach , a lovely pool with plenty of sun loungers. A sauna which runs from 12-6pm, right next to the pool. There is also a beautiful hiking trail on the beach up some beautiful rock formations which extends around the coastline and takes roughly an hour there and back and is breathtaking!We didn't attend any restaurants within the hotel so I can't comment on the quality, but we did get lunch in the lobby one day and it was very reasonably priced, about √¢‚Äö¬¨8 for a substantial burger and chips and was very delicious.Staff were all so lovely and overall the whole complex was spotlessly clean!From other reviews it seems issues were had with the all inclusive packages, I'd recommend self catering to anyone coming here as we enjoyed cooking ourselves some meals and walking 5 minutes to the local strip which had PLENTY of food options at very good prices.Overall I'd for sure come back here and intend to do so with my partner and will definitely go self catering again.

Stayed here in October with partner and 4 year old.Low rise self catering villa style apartments,balcony front and rear. Good size.Good value for money.Directly on the cliff top with steps down to the beach.Basic furniture,good kitchen - fridge/freezer,hob,microwave,kettle,toaster,filter coffee maker,all the pans and utensils you need.T.v with itv, BBC1, news.Nice well looked after gardens,Toddler,outdoor and indoor pools. Playground.Reasonably priced pool/cafe bar, cocktails ‚Ç¨4.50, large beer ‚Ç¨2.50.Mini market we didn't use as there is a large Intermarche supermarket a 10 -15 min walk up the road out of the resort.Main onsite restaurant we didn't use.Free minibus 3 times a day there and back to nearest resort town Armacao.Area around the complex is very scenic and quiet ,it's all about the beaches of which there are several within walking distance,all uncrowded, deserted at times. There are steps leading directly down to two fantastic large beaches one accessed via a tunnel cut through the cliff, or you can walk along the clifftop to a small cove beach to the right of the complex. If you walk in the other direction directly behind the Terrace club hotel you come to the Alporchinos area,there are a couple of restaurants,a patisserie and steps down to another fantastic large beach which you could easily miss. Not a lot to do at night, I think most would find it too quiet especially in October,  though travelling with a 4 year old that didn't bother us.

hotel_name: Porto Pal√É¬°cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Reception: very good service, always willing to help usElevators: Due to the accommodation capacity, they become very slow, which makes us wait around 20 to 30 minutes, as they often go up and down at maximum capacity.Breakfast: Leaves something to be desired when it comes to fruits, which were always available with a very high degree of acidityHousekeeping and cleaning: excellent staff.Location: very good, easy to get to tourist attractions.Service team: Bar and breakfasts - always very kind and willing to help us.Support service for collecting large suitcases (as stated in the Abreu package) left something to be desired upon departure, there was only one person to carry the suitcases for a group of 32 couples and a teenager.Conservation: In general, very well maintained, especially the reception, bar and breakfast room.In the bedrooms, the bathtub and floor need renovation (very stained and need grouting to avoid leaks).

We LOVED IT!  What a great view. Olivier and Patricia were most welcoming.  We stayed in the loft and loved every bit of it. The walk up and down the hill just makes the wine and dinner that much more enjoyable.  Sitting outside with a glass of wine in the evening and watching the fishing boats (octopus fishing?)  was wonderful. Make sure you try the cataplana in the restaurant in town.  We can't wait to return

We booked the Altis last minute, and it was a fantastic experience.  Located in the marina area, a short √¢‚Äö¬¨8 / 15 minutes Uber drive from Central Lisbon. This turned out to be a godsend, since the marina is an altogether calmer and less stifling oasis compared to central. The Altis is all about the staff, really friendly, helpful and always a smile. From reception to restaurant to housekeeping, they are all so warm and happy to help. The marina area is quiet by night and the Altis has two fantastic restaurants a 2 min walk opposite.. Nikkei and Vela Latina.With a relaxing spa area downstairs and a rooftop pool and sun lounging area upstairs, it's a welcome addition after a day in the city. An altogether great stay.

We travelled to the Vila Gale Tavira hotel in November 2008 for a weeks holiday.Unlike some of the earlier reviews we found the hotel to be very comfortable and at this time of the year not too busy. Tavira is a working town and not overly busy with tourists. This suited us very much as we were looking forward to a relaxing week. The hotel is only about a 10 minute walk from the centre of town which is a very attractive centre from which to explore the area. There are good links by either bus or train from Tavira to Faro and other parts of the Algarve. Our room was pleasanty furnished and overlooked the swimming pool and had a balcony. The weather was quite warm throughout the week and very pleasant for this time of the year. We did not experience any of the noise late at night which some earlier reviewers had mentioned. The restaurant had a reasonable selection available which was of a good standard.There are plenty of places of interest to visit in the town one of which is the Tuna museum. A complementary bus service runs directly from the hotel to the museum.We enjoyed our holiday so much we have already booked this hotel again for this coming November.If you are looking for a quiet relaxing holiday then this could be for you.

Great hotel location - right on beach.Very friendly staff.We went all inclusive which is good value for money- always plenty of food at breakfast lunch and dinner. However the choice is limited and the breakfast in particular is the same each day.Not complaining about the food as it was a nice offering, just the variety and choice.Drinks served from 12 - 10:30pm again you got a limited choice but always a big pour!Our room in block E was excellent- great sea view and a short walk to all facilities and the beach. We had a separate bedroom which was bliss.Evening entertainment again was limited but nice - the main entertainer Mauro is the nicest guy and a fantastic singer.Tips - there is a intermarche nearby - check on google - it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s a bit cheaper than local supermarkets and just as close.-Take a boat ride to Benimin? caves - we took the 6.5 hr with beach barbecue which was excellent.-There is a laundry on site √¢‚Äö¬¨4 for wash and √¢‚Äö¬¨4 for dryer which helped our stock of clean clothes for the week.

This hotel is in dire need of further refurbishment of the rooms. Ours came with old and stained furniture and a bad smell. It did not even have a digital safe - just an old fashioned one with a key that you get from reception. There was a stack of very old, nasty brown extra blankets in the closet that I would not dare even touch. Bathroom had been renovated so that is fine. The rest of the place is alright, especially the cliff top grassy area with sunbeds near the swimming pool. Breakfast food was poor quality. Staff was fine.

This fantastic, intimate hotel is located in a great neighborhood.  The staff could not be more welcoming and helpful.  Rooms are very spacious and there is a beautiful outdoor space for breakfast or just hanging out.  Breakfast is truly outstanding.

Nicely overlooking ocean side as well as very modern infrastructure very close by the airport.Rooms are modern design and practical.My room full facade over ocean and appreciated breakfast served in.People are professional, kind and communicate.Fantastic architecture overlooking the longest bridge in Europe in the best city -Nice People-Nice Location-Great food at affordable prices..Restaurant on ground floor is chic, clean with great food!A

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: Although the room is not big, but the equipment is very complete!  Although the TV could not be connected to Youtube, after informing the staff, the staff quickly came to test and deal with it!  The counter staff are very kind, and the breakfast is delicious!

Stayed here in early June with family.  The room was spotlessly clean and nice.  The location is great, on a small square just off Avenida Liberdade.  Easy walking distance to Rossio, Chiado, Bairro Alto and Baixa.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Plenty of restaurants nearby.  Building next door is being renovated and there was some construction noise during the day but it was very quiet in the evenings and early mornings.  Would stay here again.
This place is situated on the top of the mountain. It has beautiful views, really nice restaurant and bar, welcoming atmosphere. You can count on comfy bed and nice breackfast.

Stayed here for three nights in March. Great location, meters from the metro station. My booking rate didn't include breakfast but we could still just turn up at the hotel restaurant and have it for 6 euros pp only, which I think is a great price for a buffet. Overall great value for money.

Very nice trip in family. We loved everything! The gardens were well maintained, the views‚Äîespecially the sea views‚Äîwere amazing, and the staff were very kind and helpful, but I have to highlight the restaurant staff in particular. I had dinner there on a Wednesday and brought a fish I had caught myself, which I kindly asked if they could prepare for me. The entire restaurant staff, and especially the chef, were incredibly accommodating. They asked the chef to cook it for us, and it turned out absolutely delicious! We are truly grateful for all the friendliness and willingness to help, and of course, for the excellent meal, which deserves a special mention. Thank you so much for making our experience unforgettable! Please, come to Pestana Bahia Praia, you won‚Äôt regret it at all! We truly felt at home.

The hotel was very clean and comfortable. We had booked a family room (2 adults+teens) with views of the bay and Funchal. The rooms are spacious and the beds super comfortable. The only criticism here, there were for us a bit few cabinets for the clothes of four people.As meals we had booked half board. In the morning there is a rich buffet and in the evening a 3-course menu which changes daily. There is also an extra children's menu (up to 12 years) and a menu for vegetarians, but these are not changed.The location of the hotel is good, it is about 30 minutes walk and you are in the city center of Funchal. Outside the door is a bus stop for the regular buses and the bus to the airport. There is free parking. Car hire providers are nearby (but you can also get help from the hotel here)We really liked the hotel. All the many people- at the reception, in the restaurants, in front of and behind the scenes do a great job, are always friendly and helpful to give guests a relaxing and nice holiday. We felt very comfortable and if we come back to Madeira we will definitely book here again

From the moment we arrived at the guest house I knew we were in for a great stay. The house itself is beautifully decorated and has a real homely feel but it is the garden area that is truly beautiful- very secluded and quiet the perfect place to relax in the sun. We received a very warm welcome from the lovely owner who took the time to show us around and tell us some history about the building.We arrived early but our room was ready after only a 5 minute wait. The room we were in was Azores one of the standard rooms in the older part of the hotel, it had a lovely balcony with direct access to the gardens. The room itself was clean and brightly decorated with every thing we needed for our stay. One thing I would say is if you are a light sleeper or like to sleep in you would be better asking for a different room as it is directly above the breakfast room and was quite loud from around 7.30am onwards as other guests started breakfast. (The Timor room next to ours would also have the same issue)Breakfast was plentiful, continental style but enough to suit all tastes and the honesty bar and free Nespresso coffee was a nice touch.The location is a short 10 min (maximum) walk to the centre of Cascais. Some other reviews have mentioned that the uphill walk back from town is a little tough however we had no issue with this and wouldn't describe it as a difficult walk.The hotel also offer a driver service to the airport which we used and for ‚Ç¨45 was much more convenient than getting the train.Overall a great place for a relaxing break, would highly recommend.

We spent 4 days at White at the end of September and we really enjoyed it. Location is amazing-right at the cliffs with stunning views over the ocean and with easy reach to all attractions on the island. Interior, pool area and apartments itself are designed with attention to every detail. If you are lucky enough like we and the hotel is half occupied you can enjoy magnificent sun rises and sun sets in infinity pool with no one around you.Breakfast is cook to order so don‚Äôt expect buffet but variety of different cold cuts and sweet bites.Some minor negative remarks as a room for future improvement:- no daily supply of toiletries to the apartment- staff should remove cushions from a pool area for a night so that these stay dry for a morning swim or breakfastAll in all, this place is magnificent and when you are looking for a spot for a romantic getaway in Azores White is not to be missed!

We have just left this hotel and honestly it is not a one we will return to.On first glance it was lovely and there is some nice staff but some need educated on customer service and how to speak to guests.If you have mobility issues I would advise against staying here, there is no lifts to to the restaurant and you have to enter via the pool area through a fire exit, the disable toilet in the reception was out of order and the disabled shower at the pool also did not work so having to get up and down stairs to use a shower is not ideal at all and god forbid you are wheelchair bound you have no chance! You get kicked out of rooms at 10am on check out days and check in days you can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t get in till 5 unless you are lucky and your room is ready at 2pm.The a le Carte restaurants on site are tiny and only take 3 bookings per half hour and they are constantly booked up even though you get told to come back each day at 4pm for the following days availabilities yet my husband went dead on 4pm and somehow it was fully booked, we decided to go to the tapas restaurant and check with them directly to which we were told they did have space!Rooms - these are ok but need updating.Rating - I would not class this as a 4* hotel at all it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s more like a 2+/3 star.Expect lot of teenagers there for partying, we were woke most night/mornings around 4/5am with them coming in from The Strip.

The hotel is very nice, with a very beautiful garden with comfy chairs, great breakfast, very good beds and perfectly friendly staff. Totally recommended. If possible book sea view, this looks wonderful.

Very good hotel. Delicious restaurant. Very attentive, kind, competent, soulful service. Very well decorated environment, spacious room and beautiful view of the river. It's worth every minute. Great location, you can walk, cycle, run, peacefully amidst the trees on the riverbank.

hotel_name: Quinta do Morgado - Monte da Eira Apartments
date: Ant√≥nio J Cwrote a review Sep 2010
text: This is a calm and clean resort . There are 2 swimmingpolls, kinder area, a bar at the entrance and a supermarket near the entrance (50 meters). There is a shopping centre with a big supermarket near (7 minutes walking). The Apartment is equipped with modern appliances, is very clean and comfortable. The staff is very kindfull.They gave us a upgrad for our apartment. My children liked very much to stay here. Tavira is a beautiful town. Beaches are farway from this resort. We can go to Tavira Island by boat but you need a car to go to the port. We can go to others beaches but using a car. I recommend this resort to all people who want to spend their hollidays in a calm place.

We spent the second night of our Portugal tour at Vila Gale Coimbra. The hotel is located about 10 minutes by foot from downtown Coimbra. During check-in, we asked for a nice view and received a free upgrade to a river view room with balcony. The rooms are nice, featuring great bedding and spacious bathrooms. WiFi was reasonably fast and reliable Our personal highlight was the hotel's generous wellness area, including a heated indoor pool, a state-of-the-art jacuzzi, an amazing Turkish bath and a sauna (which we unfortunately could not use due to time constrains). Breakfast was spectacular: A wide selection of cold and warm items, topped off by delicious Portuguese sparkling wine. Only the coffee and juices could have been better. We would definitely stay at Vila Gale Coimbra again.

We only spent a night at Cinco and we would have loved to stay longer ! Carole is a very nice host, she told us everything we need to know regarding the place and to visit Sintra in 24h. The b&b is really big and very clean with a lovely view on the garden; the breakfast is on your own, but everything is ready on the fridge, so you can take it whenever you want. I recommend this b&b !

A relatively compact campsite for Campervans, with a lot of space given to their own hut accommodation, and additional space for tents. Would get fully booked up in high season so worth booking ahead. Friendly and attentive staff.The toilet block was immaculate (no toilet paper). There is only a basic snack bar on site and most of the restaurants in the area are in Ger√™s which is a deceptively long drive away, especially if you have a campervan or RV as the roads in the area are very twisty indeed! Worth a visit to the small family restaurant 10 minutes walk away in Ermida if you are happy with very simple menu.

This is a fantastic place right up in the hills above Figueira da Foz so the views of the town and the beach are amazing. You will need a car for access to Figueira.. The village of Serra da Boa (residential area) is small, there are a couple of very small bars and a shop.Casa Pinha rooms are  actually in the grounds of the Restaurant. They actually look like 2 little rows of chalets. The rooms are very basic but the are very clean with large bathroom. Fridge which was handy but no tea/coffee making facilities. Room cleaned and towels changed daily. Staff very friendly although barely any English spoken! Although we got by being there 8 days!! Pool area looked very nice & very clean although we didnt make use of it. We were in Number 3 which had a view of the sea. There was a  table & chairs outside by the door which was nice to sit & relax with a great view.

saw the pictures of this hotel and changed my mind to stay here. Would never go back. The hotel is not very clean and the entire place is run down and needs to be completely refurbished. When closing our balcony door the wall collapsed and the rest of the building is not much better. The pool tiles were all broken and although in the most beautiful setting not worth the money. I have stayed in better one star hotels. Also very high up and if you dont want to drive after a drink then the walk back up to the hotel is very dangerous and not well lit. Sorry but a beautiful view alone does not make for a good holiday.
